title: 113_hr4121
content:
The Small Business Development Centers Improvement Act of 2014, also known as the Small Business Act, authorizes entrepreneurial development programs. The Administrator is directed to use specific programs to provide support for entrepreneurs, business education, incubation services, and more. An exception is made for services to small businesses owned by Indian tribes. Additionally, an annual report to the Committee on Small Business is required starting from December 1 after the enactment of this subsection. The Administrator is required to annually report to the Committee on Small Business on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, operating details, grant award processes, and a list of awardees, contractors, and vendors. The Administrator must report annually to the Committee on Small Business on entrepreneurial development activities, including program descriptions, grant award processes, awardees, contractors, vendors, funding obligations, and responsible individuals for each program and activity. SEC. 3. MARKETING OF SERVICES.

Section 21 of the Small Business Act is amended to allow grant recipients to market their services without prohibition.

SEC. 4. CONFIDENTIALITY REQUIREMENTS.

Section 21(a)(7)(A) of the Small Business Act is amended to include sharing information with State, local, Federal agencies, or third parties.

SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. SEC. 5. DATA COLLECTION. Amends Small Business Act to include governing data collection activities for grant recipients and requires an annual report on data collection related to the Small Business Development Center program. SEC. 6. MATCHMAKING AND OTHER EVENTS. Amends the Small Business Act to allow Small Business Development Centers to collect fees from private partnerships and cosponsorships. 

SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Amends the Small Business Act to make changes regarding equity for SBDCs.

SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Addresses the awarding of grants to SBDCs. SEC. 7. EQUITY FOR SBDCS. Section 21(a)(4)(C)(v)(I) of the Small Business Act is amended to remove certain items. SEC. 8. AWARD OF GRANTS TO SBDCS. Limits grants to entities that previously received grants before September 30, 2014. SEC. 9. DISASTER REFORMS. Section 21(b)(3) of the Small Business Act is amended to allow small business development centers to provide assistance to out-of-state small businesses for disaster recovery without geographic limitations. Small business development centers can assist small businesses located outside the state affected by a declared disaster, ensuring continuity of services in any state. Small business development centers must ensure continuity of services in any state where they provide services during a declared disaster. The Administrator should allow center personnel to use designated sites for disaster recovery assistance. SEC. 10. INCLUSIONS OF ENTREPRENEURSHIP TRAINING FOR UNEMPLOYED INDIVIDUALS: Amends the Small Business Act to include educating unemployed individuals on entrepreneurship and assisting them in starting new businesses.
